description: From Middle French personnage, from Old French personage.

entries.meaning: A person, especially one who is famous or important.
examples: I can only say they have been in pretty close conversation several times of late, and, if I dared to think it of so very calm and dignified a personage, I should say that her color was a little heightened after one or more of these interviews.

entries.meaning: The creation of corporate persons named after living people.
